docs.title: tmq (TOML Query)
docs.text:
tmq is a lightweight and flexible command-line TOML processor. Like jq for JSON, yq for YAML — tmq is for TOML.

tmq lets you query, modify, validate, and compare TOML files with simple dot-notation syntax. Slice nested tables, update values in-place, batch process configs, or convert to JSON and YAML — all from the command line with a single binary.

tmq is written in Go: zero dependencies, one executable. Download for Linux, macOS, or Windows and run it anywhere.

tmq = TOML + Query

docs.title: ✅ Implemented Features
docs.text:
• Query & Read: Access nested TOML values with dot notation
  • Modify & Write: Set, delete, and update TOML values in-place
  • Validation: Check TOML file syntax and structure
  • Comparison: Compare two TOML files for differences
  • Bulk Operations: Process multiple files at once
  • Output Formats: JSON, YAML, and TOML output
  • Script-Friendly: Clear exit codes and error messages
  • Cross-Platform: Linux, macOS, Windows binaries

docs.title: Bulk Operations
docs.text: tmq supports processing multiple TOML files simultaneously, making it ideal for batch processing, configuration management, and automation tasks.

docs.title: Query Multiple Files
docs.text:
# Get version from all config files
tmq '.version' config/*.toml

# Output format:
# config/app.toml: "1.0.0"
# config/database.toml: "2.1.0"
# config/server.toml: "1.5.0"

docs.title: Bulk Validation
docs.text:
# Validate all TOML files in directory
tmq --validate config/*.toml

# Validate recursively
find . -name "*.toml" -exec tmq --validate {} \;

docs.title: Bulk Modification
docs.text:
# Update version in all config files
tmq '.version = "2.0.0"' -i config/*.toml

# This updates all matching files in-place

docs.title: Query Results
docs.text:
# Default output (filename: value)
tmq '.database.host' config/*.toml
# config/app.toml: "localhost"
# config/prod.toml: "prod-db.example.com"

# JSON output
tmq '.database.host' config/*.toml -o json
# {"config/app.toml": "localhost", "config/prod.toml": "prod-db.example.com"}

# Custom formatting with scripts
tmq '.version' config/*.toml | while IFS=: read -r file version; do
    echo "File: $file, Version: $version"
done

docs.title: Continue on Error
docs.text:
# Process all files even if some fail
tmq '.version' config/*.toml || true

# Check individual exit codes
for file in config/*.toml; do
    if tmq '.version' "$file" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo "$file: OK"
    else
        echo "$file: FAILED"
    fi
done

docs.title: Error Aggregation
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Script to handle bulk operations with error reporting

process_files() {
    local operation="$1"
    local files="$2"
    local errors=()

    for file in $files; do
        if ! tmq "$operation" "$file" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            errors+=("$file")
        fi
    done

    if [ ${#errors[@]} -gt 0 ]; then
        echo "Failed files:"
        printf '  %s\n' "${errors[@]}"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Validate all configs
if ! process_files "--validate" "config/*.toml"; then
    echo "Some files failed validation"
    exit 1
fi

echo "All files validated successfully"

docs.title: Conditional Processing
docs.text:
# Only process files with specific criteria
for file in config/*.toml; do
    # Check if file has a specific key
    if tmq '.production' "$file" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo "Processing production config: $file"
        tmq '.version = "stable"' -i "$file"
    fi
done

docs.title: Batch Updates with Backup
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Safe bulk update with backup

BACKUP_DIR="config-backup-$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)"
mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

# Create backups
for file in config/*.toml; do
    cp "$file" "$BACKUP_DIR/"
done

echo "Backups created in $BACKUP_DIR"

# Perform bulk update
tmq '.updated_at = "$(date)"' -i config/*.toml

# Validate all files
if tmq --validate config/*.toml >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo "✓ All files updated and validated successfully"
else
    echo "✗ Some files failed validation, restoring backups..."
    for file in "$BACKUP_DIR"/*.toml; do
        basename_file=$(basename "$file")
        cp "$file" "config/$basename_file"
    done
    echo "Backups restored"
    exit 1
fi

docs.title: Configuration Migration
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Migrate configuration structure across multiple files

echo "Starting configuration migration..."

# Rename keys
for file in config/*.toml; do
    echo "Migrating $file..."

    # Rename database.host to database.hostname
    host=$(tmq '.database.host' "$file" 2>/dev/null)
    if [ -n "$host" ]; then
        tmq ".database.hostname = $host" -i "$file"
        tmq 'del(.database.host)' -i "$file"
    fi

    # Add new default values
    tmq '.database.port = 5432' -i "$file"
    tmq '.features.logging = true' -i "$file"
done

# Validate all migrated files
if tmq --validate config/*.toml >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo "✓ Migration completed successfully"
else
    echo "✗ Migration failed - check files manually"
    exit 1
fi

docs.title: Recursive Processing
docs.text:
# Process all TOML files in directory tree
find . -name "*.toml" -type f -exec tmq '.version' {} \;

# Process files in specific directories
tmq '.version' config/**/*.toml

docs.title: Organized Output
docs.text:
# Group output by directory
for dir in config/*/ ; do
    echo "=== $dir ==="
    tmq '.version' "$dir"*.toml
done

docs.title: Parallel Processing
docs.text:
# Process files in parallel (basic)
for file in config/*.toml; do
    tmq '.version' "$file" &
done
wait

# Advanced parallel processing
#!/bin/bash
MAX_JOBS=4
process_file() {
    local file="$1"
    echo "Processing $file..."
    tmq '.version' "$file"
}

export -f process_file

# Use xargs for parallel execution
find config/ -name "*.toml" -print0 |
    xargs -0 -n1 -P"$MAX_JOBS" bash -c 'process_file "$@"' --

docs.title: Batch Size Management
docs.text:
# Process files in batches to avoid memory issues
BATCH_SIZE=10
files=(config/*.toml)
total_files=${#files[@]}

for ((i=0; i<total_files; i+=BATCH_SIZE)); do
    batch_files=("${files[@]:i:BATCH_SIZE}")
    echo "Processing batch ${i}/${total_files}..."

    # Process batch
    tmq '.version' "${batch_files[@]}" > "batch_$((i/BATCH_SIZE)).log"
done

docs.title: CI/CD Pipeline
docs.text:
# .github/workflows/bulk-update.yml
name: Bulk Configuration Update

on:
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      new_version:
        description: 'New version to set'
        required: true

jobs:
  update:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: checkout@v4

      - name: Setup tmq
        run: |
          wget https://github.com/azolfagharj/tmq/releases/latest/download/tmq-linux-amd64
          chmod +x tmq-linux-amd64
          sudo mv tmq-linux-amd64 /usr/local/bin/tmq

      - name: Update versions
        run: |
          tmq ".version = \"${{ github.event.inputs.new_version }}\"" -i config/*.toml

      - name: Validate changes
        run: tmq --validate config/*.toml

      - name: Create pull request
        uses: peter-evans/create-pull-request@v5
        with:
          title: "Update configuration versions to ${{ github.event.inputs.new_version }}"
          body: "Bulk update of version fields across all configuration files"

docs.title: Configuration Management
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Configuration management script

CONFIG_DIR="config"
ENVIRONMENTS=("development" "staging" "production")

# Update environment-specific settings
for env in "${ENVIRONMENTS[@]}"; do
    echo "Updating $env configuration..."

    tmq ".environment = \"$env\"" -i "$CONFIG_DIR/$env.toml"

    case $env in
        "development")
            tmq '.debug = true' -i "$CONFIG_DIR/$env.toml"
            tmq '.database.host = "localhost"' -i "$CONFIG_DIR/$env.toml"
            ;;
        "staging")
            tmq '.debug = false' -i "$CONFIG_DIR/$env.toml"
            tmq '.database.host = "staging-db.example.com"' -i "$CONFIG_DIR/$env.toml"
            ;;
        "production")
            tmq '.debug = false' -i "$CONFIG_DIR/$env.toml"
            tmq '.database.host = "prod-db.example.com"' -i "$CONFIG_DIR/$env.toml"
            ;;
    esac
done

# Validate all configurations
echo "Validating all configurations..."
tmq --validate "$CONFIG_DIR"/*.toml

echo "Configuration update complete"

docs.title: Progress Tracking
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Bulk operation with progress reporting

files=(config/*.toml)
total=${#files[@]}
processed=0

echo "Processing $total files..."

for file in "${files[@]}"; do
    ((processed++))
    echo -ne "Progress: $processed/$total\r"

    if ! tmq '.version' "$file" >/dev/null; then
        echo "Failed: $file"
    fi
done

echo -e "\nProcessing complete"

docs.title: Summary Reports
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Generate summary report of configuration status

echo "=== Configuration Status Report ==="
echo

# Count total files
total_files=$(ls config/*.toml 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
echo "Total configuration files: $total_files"

# Count valid files
valid_files=$(tmq --validate config/*.toml >/dev/null 2>&1 && echo "$total_files" || echo "0")
echo "Valid TOML files: $valid_files"

# List versions
echo
echo "Version summary:"
tmq '.version // "unknown"' config/*.toml | sort | uniq -c | sort -nr

# Check for common issues
echo
echo "Potential issues:"
for file in config/*.toml; do
    # Check for deprecated settings
    if tmq '.deprecated_setting' "$file" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo "  ⚠️  $file contains deprecated setting"
    fi
done

docs.title: Backup Strategy
docs.text:
# Always backup before bulk operations
backup_dir="backup-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S)"
mkdir -p "$backup_dir"
cp config/*.toml "$backup_dir/"
echo "Backup created in $backup_dir"

docs.title: Dry Run Testing
docs.text:
# Test bulk operations with dry-run first
echo "Testing bulk update (dry-run)..."
if tmq '.version = "test"' --dry-run config/*.toml >/dev/null; then
    echo "✓ Dry-run successful, proceeding with actual update..."
    tmq '.version = "test"' -i config/*.toml
else
    echo "✗ Dry-run failed, aborting"
    exit 1
fi

docs.title: Rollback Capability
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Bulk update with rollback capability

ROLLBACK_FILE="rollback-$(date +%s).sh"

# Generate rollback script
cat > "$ROLLBACK_FILE" << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
echo "Rolling back configuration changes..."
EOF

# Store current values for rollback
for file in config/*.toml; do
    version=$(tmq '.version' "$file" 2>/dev/null || echo '""')
    echo "tmq '.version = $version' -i '$file'" >> "$ROLLBACK_FILE"
done

chmod +x "$ROLLBACK_FILE"

# Perform bulk update
tmq '.version = "2.0.0"' -i config/*.toml

# Test if everything works
if ./test-configuration.sh; then
    echo "✓ Update successful"
    rm "$ROLLBACK_FILE"  # Clean up rollback script
else
    echo "✗ Update failed, rolling back..."
    ./"$ROLLBACK_FILE"
    echo "Rollback complete"
fi

docs.title: Command Reference
docs.text: Complete reference for all tmq commands, flags, and options.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
tmq [OPTIONS] [QUERY] [FILE...]
tmq [OPTIONS] --validate [FILE...]
tmq [OPTIONS] --compare FILE1 FILE2

docs.title: Output Options
docs.text:
• -o, --output FORMAT: Output format (toml, json, yaml)
  • Default: toml
  • Example: tmq '.data' config.toml -o json

docs.title: Modification Options
docs.text:
• -i, --inplace: Modify files in-place
  • Must be used with set/delete operations
  • Example: tmq '.version = "2.0"' -i config.toml

docs.title: Dry Run
docs.text:
• --dry-run: Preview changes without modifying files
  • Shows what would be done
  • Exit code 0 for success, 1 for errors
  • Example: tmq '.version = "2.0"' --dry-run config.toml

docs.title: Validation
docs.text:
• --validate: Validate TOML syntax
  • Exit code 0 if valid, 1 if invalid
  • Can process multiple files
  • Example: tmq --validate config.toml

docs.title: Comparison
docs.text:
• --compare FILE1 FILE2: Compare two TOML files
  • Exit code 0 if identical, 1 if different
  • Shows detailed differences
  • Example: tmq --compare old.toml new.toml

docs.title: Information
docs.text:
• -v, --version: Show version information
  • -h, --help: Show help text

docs.title: Basic Queries
docs.text:
# Root key
.key

# Nested table
.table.key

# Deep nesting
.app.database.host

# Array element
.array[0]

# Array element with nesting
.servers[1].name

docs.title: Set Operations
docs.text:
# Simple assignment
.key = "value"

# Number assignment
.port = 8080

# Boolean assignment
.enabled = true

# Array assignment
.tags = ["web", "api"]

# Object assignment
.config = { host = "localhost", port = 5432 }

docs.title: Delete Operations
docs.text:
# Delete root key
del(.key)

# Delete nested key
del(.table.key)

# Delete array element
del(.array[0])

docs.title: Query Examples
docs.text:
# Simple query
tmq '.version' config.toml

# Nested query
tmq '.database.host' config.toml

# Array query
tmq '.servers[0].name' config.toml

# Multiple files
tmq '.version' config/*.toml

# JSON output
tmq '.config' file.toml -o json

# YAML output
tmq '.config' file.toml -o yaml

docs.title: Modification Examples
docs.text:
# Set string value
tmq '.version = "2.0.0"' -i config.toml

# Set nested value
tmq '.database.host = "prod-db"' -i config.toml

# Set array
tmq '.ports = [8080, 8443]' -i config.toml

# Delete key
tmq 'del(.obsolete)' -i config.toml

# Dry run
tmq '.version = "test"' --dry-run config.toml

docs.title: Validation Examples
docs.text:
# Single file
tmq --validate config.toml

# Multiple files
tmq --validate *.toml

# In script
if tmq --validate config.toml; then
    echo "Valid TOML"
fi

docs.title: Comparison Examples
docs.text:
# Compare files
tmq --compare config1.toml config2.toml

# In script
if tmq --compare expected.toml actual.toml; then
    echo "Files match"
fi

docs.title: Exit Codes
docs.text: Code Meaning Description 0 Success Operation completed successfully 1 Parse Error TOML parsing failed or query error 2 Usage Error Invalid command-line arguments 3 Security Error Path traversal or security violation 4 File Error File not found, permission denied, etc.

docs.title: Error Messages
docs.text:
tmq provides structured error messages:

ERROR: <error_type>
DETAILS: <detailed_description>
ACTION: <suggested_fix>

docs.title: Parse Errors
docs.text:
tmq '.invalid..' config.toml
# ERROR: Invalid query path
# DETAILS: Query path cannot be empty
# ACTION: Check your query syntax

docs.title: File Errors
docs.text:
tmq '.' nonexistent.toml
# ERROR: File operation error
# DETAILS: Cannot read file 'nonexistent.toml'
# ACTION: Ensure the file exists and is readable

docs.title: Validation Errors
docs.text:
tmq --validate malformed.toml
# ERROR: TOML parsing failed
# DETAILS: Expected newline at line 5, column 10
# ACTION: Fix the TOML syntax error

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text: tmq does not use environment variables for configuration. All options are specified via command-line flags.

docs.title: TOML Input
docs.text:
tmq accepts standard TOML 1.0.0 format:

# Comments are preserved in output
title = "Example"

[database]
host = "localhost"
port = 5432

[[servers]]
name = "web1"
ip = "192.168.1.1"

docs.title: JSON Output
docs.text:
{
  "title": "Example",
  "database": {
    "host": "localhost",
    "port": 5432
  },
  "servers": [
    {
      "name": "web1",
      "ip": "192.168.1.1"
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: YAML Output
docs.text:
title: Example
database:
  host: localhost
  port: 5432
servers:
- name: web1
  ip: 192.168.1.1

docs.title: Benchmarks
docs.text:
• Query operations: O(1) - constant time
  • File parsing: O(n) where n is file size
  • Memory usage: < 10MB for typical files
  • Large files: Scales linearly with size

docs.title: Optimization Tips
docs.text:
• Use specific queries instead of full file output
  • Prefer JSON/YAML output for programmatic use
  • Use bulk operations for multiple files

docs.title: Supported Platforms
docs.text:
• Linux: amd64, arm64
  • macOS: amd64 (Intel), arm64 (Apple Silicon)
  • Windows: amd64

docs.title: Binary Names
docs.text:
• tmq-linux-amd64 (Linux Intel/AMD)
  • tmq-linux-arm64 (Linux ARM)
  • tmq-darwin-amd64 (macOS Intel)
  • tmq-darwin-arm64 (macOS Apple Silicon)
  • tmq-windows-amd64.exe (Windows)

docs.title: Current Limitations
docs.text:
• No JSON/YAML → TOML conversion (planned)
  • No comment preservation in modifications (planned)
  • No plugin system (planned)
  • No library API (planned)

docs.title: File Size Limits
docs.text:
• Maximum file size: 100MB
  • Recommended: < 10MB for optimal performance

docs.title: Path Length Limits
docs.text:
• Maximum path length: 1024 characters
  • Maximum nesting depth: 100 levels

docs.title: Debug Mode

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: Comprehensive collection of tmq usage examples for common scenarios.

docs.title: Application Configuration
docs.text:
# app.toml
[app]
name = "myapp"
version = "1.0.0"
debug = true

[database]
host = "localhost"
port = 5432
name = "myapp_db"

[logging]
level = "info"
file = "/var/log/myapp.log"

# Get application info
tmq '.app.name' app.toml          # "myapp"
tmq '.app.version' app.toml       # "1.0.0"

# Database configuration
tmq '.database' app.toml
# Output: host = "localhost"
#         port = 5432
#         name = "myapp_db"

# Update for production
tmq '.app.debug = false' -i app.toml
tmq '.database.host = "prod-db.example.com"' -i app.toml

docs.title: Environment-Specific Configs
docs.text:
# config.toml
environment = "development"

[database]
host = "localhost"
port = 5432

[features]
debug = true
metrics = false

# Switch to production
tmq '.environment = "production"' -i config.toml
tmq '.database.host = "prod-db.cluster.com"' -i config.toml
tmq '.database.port = 3306' -i config.toml
tmq '.features.debug = false' -i config.toml
tmq '.features.metrics = true' -i config.toml

# Verify changes
tmq '.' config.toml

docs.title: Nginx-style Config
docs.text:
# nginx.toml
[server]
listen = 80
server_name = "example.com"
root = "/var/www/html"

[ssl]
enabled = false
certificate = "/etc/ssl/certs/example.crt"
key = "/etc/ssl/private/example.key"

[[locations]]
path = "/"
try_files = ["$uri", "$uri/", "/index.html"]

[[locations]]
path = "/api"
proxy_pass = "http://localhost:3000"

# Server configuration
tmq '.server' nginx.toml

# SSL setup
tmq '.ssl.enabled = true' -i nginx.toml
tmq '.ssl.certificate = "/etc/letsencrypt/live/example.com/fullchain.pem"' -i nginx.toml
tmq '.ssl.key = "/etc/letsencrypt/live/example.com/privkey.pem"' -i nginx.toml

# Add API location
tmq '.locations = [{ path = "/api", proxy_pass = "http://api:8080" }]' -i nginx.toml

docs.title: Database Configuration
docs.text:
# database.toml
[connection]
host = "localhost"
port = 5432
database = "myapp"
username = "app_user"
ssl_mode = "require"

[pool]
min_connections = 2
max_connections = 20
idle_timeout = 300

[migrations]
enabled = true
path = "./migrations"

# Connection string
HOST=$(tmq '.connection.host' database.toml)
PORT=$(tmq '.connection.port' database.toml)
DB=$(tmq '.connection.database' database.toml)
USER=$(tmq '.connection.username' database.toml)

echo "postgresql://$USER@$HOST:$PORT/$DB"

# Pool configuration
tmq '.pool' database.toml -o json

# Enable migrations
tmq '.migrations.enabled = true' -i database.toml

docs.title: GitHub Actions Config
docs.text:
# .github/config.toml
[build]
go_version = "1.23"
platforms = ["linux/amd64", "linux/arm64", "darwin/amd64", "darwin/arm64"]

[test]
race_detector = true
coverage = true
threshold = 80

[release]
draft = false
prerelease = false
generate_release_notes = true

# Update Go version across all workflows
find .github/workflows -name "*.yml" -exec \
    tmq '.build.go_version = "1.24"' -i {} \;

# Update test coverage threshold
tmq '.test.threshold = 85' -i .github/config.toml

# Enable race detector
tmq '.test.race_detector = true' -i .github/config.toml

docs.title: Package Configuration
docs.text:
# package.toml
[package]
name = "tmq"
version = "1.0.0"
description = "TOML Query Tool"
authors = ["Your Name <your@email.com>"]

[dependencies]
toml = "1.0.0"
clap = "4.0"

[build]
target = "x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu"
release = true

# Version management
CURRENT_VERSION=$(tmq '.package.version' package.toml)
echo "Current version: $CURRENT_VERSION"

# Update version
NEW_VERSION="1.0.1"

docs.title: Schema Validation
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Validate configuration against schema

validate_config() {
    local file="$1"

    # Check required fields
    required_fields=(".app.name" ".database.host" ".server.port")
    for field in "${required_fields[@]}"; do
        if ! tmq "$field" "$file" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo "Missing required field: $field"
            return 1
        fi
    done

    # Check port range
    port=$(tmq '.server.port' "$file")
    if [ "$port" -lt 1024 ] || [ "$port" -gt 65535 ]; then
        echo "Invalid port: $port"
        return 1
    fi

    return 0
}

# Validate all configs
for config in config/*.toml; do
    if validate_config "$config"; then
        echo "✓ $config is valid"
    else
        echo "✗ $config is invalid"
        exit 1
    fi
done

docs.title: Configuration Migration
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Migrate old configuration format to new format

migrate_config() {
    local file="$1"

    # Migrate old field names
    if tmq '.old_database_host' "$file" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        host=$(tmq '.old_database_host' "$file")
        tmq ".database.host = $host" -i "$file"
        tmq 'del(.old_database_host)' -i "$file"
    fi

    # Add new required fields with defaults
    tmq '.database.port = 5432' -i "$file"
    tmq '.features.logging = true' -i "$file"
    tmq '.version = "1.0.0"' -i "$file"
}

# Migrate all configurations
for config in config/*.toml; do
    echo "Migrating $config..."
    migrate_config "$config"
done

# Validate migrated configs
tmq --validate config/*.toml

docs.title: Environment Overrides
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Manage multiple environments

ENVIRONMENTS=("development" "staging" "production")
BASE_CONFIG="config/base.toml"

for env in "${ENVIRONMENTS[@]}"; do
    config_file="config/$env.toml"

    # Copy base config
    cp "$BASE_CONFIG" "$config_file"

    # Apply environment-specific overrides
    case $env in
        "development")
            tmq '.debug = true' -i "$config_file"
            tmq '.database.host = "localhost"' -i "$config_file"
            tmq '.logging.level = "debug"' -i "$config_file"
            ;;
        "staging")
            tmq '.debug = false' -i "$config_file"
            tmq '.database.host = "staging-db.example.com"' -i "$config_file"
            tmq '.logging.level = "info"' -i "$config_file"
            ;;
        "production")
            tmq '.debug = false' -i "$config_file"
            tmq '.database.host = "prod-db-cluster.example.com"' -i "$config_file"
            tmq '.logging.level = "warn"' -i "$config_file"
            ;;
    esac

    echo "Generated $config_file"
done

# Validate all generated configs
tmq --validate config/*.toml

docs.title: Configuration Backup
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Backup configuration with versioning

backup_config() {
    local source_dir="$1"
    local backup_dir="$2"

    timestamp=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)
    backup_path="$backup_dir/backup_$timestamp"

    mkdir -p "$backup_path"

    # Copy all configs
    cp "$source_dir"/*.toml "$backup_path/"

    # Create manifest
    cat > "$backup_path/manifest.txt" << EOF
Backup created: $(date)
Source: $source_dir
Files: $(ls -1 "$backup_path"/*.toml | wc -l)

Configuration versions:
$(for file in "$backup_path"/*.toml; do
    version=$(tmq '.version // "unknown"' "$file" 2>/dev/null || echo "unknown")
    echo "$(basename "$file"): $version"
done)
EOF

    echo "Backup created: $backup_path"
}

# Usage
backup_config "config" "backups"

docs.title: Configuration Restore
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Restore configuration from backup

restore_config() {
    local backup_path="$1"
    local target_dir="$2"

    if [ ! -d "$backup_path" ]; then
        echo "Backup not found: $backup_path"
        return 1
    fi

    echo "Restoring from $backup_path..."

    # Validate backup files
    if ! tmq --validate "$backup_path"/*.toml >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo "Backup contains invalid files"
        return 1
    fi

    # Create restore point
    restore_backup="$target_dir/restore_backup_$(date +%s)"
    mkdir -p "$restore_backup"
    cp "$target_dir"/*.toml "$restore_backup/" 2>/dev/null || true

    # Restore files
    cp "$backup_path"/*.toml "$target_dir/"

    # Validate restored files
    if tmq --validate "$target_dir"/*.toml >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo "✓ Restore successful"
        echo "Previous state backed up to: $restore_backup"
        return 0
    else
        echo "✗ Restore failed - restoring previous state"
        cp "$restore_backup"/*.toml "$target_dir/" 2>/dev/null || true
        return 1
    fi
}

# Usage
restore_config "backups/backup_20240115_143000" "config"

#!/bin/bash
# Generate configuration based on environment variables

generate_config() {
    local output_file="$1"

    cat > "$output_file" << EOF
[app]
name = "$(tmq '.app.name' base.toml)"
version = "$(tmq '.app.version' base.toml)"
environment = "${ENVIRONMENT:-development}"

[database]
host = "${DB_HOST:-localhost}"
port = ${DB_PORT:-5432}
name = "${DB_NAME:-myapp}"

[features]
debug = ${DEBUG:-false}
metrics = ${METRICS:-true}
EOF

    # Validate generated config
    if tmq --validate "$output_file" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo "Generated valid config: $output_file"
    else
        echo "Generated invalid config"
        return 1
    fi
}

generate_config "config/generated.toml"

docs.title: Configuration Diff and Patch
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Show configuration changes between versions

config_diff() {
    local old_file="$1"
    local new_file="$2"

    echo "Configuration changes:"
    echo "======================"

    # Compare versions
    old_version=$(tmq '.version // "unknown"' "$old_file")
    new_version=$(tmq '.version // "unknown"' "$new_file")

    if [ "$old_version" != "$new_version" ]; then
        echo "Version: $old_version → $new_version"
    fi

    # Compare key settings
    keys_to_check=(".database.host" ".database.port" ".debug" ".logging.level")

    for key in "${keys_to_check[@]}"; do
        old_value=$(tmq "$key" "$old_file" 2>/dev/null || echo "not set")
        new_value=$(tmq "$key" "$new_file" 2>/dev/null || echo "not set")

        if [ "$old_value" != "$new_value" ]; then
            echo "$key: $old_value → $new_value"
        fi
    done
}

config_diff "config/v1.0.toml" "config/v1.1.toml"

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This guide covers the basics of using tmq to work with TOML files.

docs.title: TOML Structure
docs.text:
TOML files use a simple, human-readable format:

# config.toml
title = "My Application"

[database]
host = "localhost"
port = 5432
enabled = true

[server]
host = "0.0.0.0"
port = 8080

[[users]]
name = "Alice"
role = "admin"

[[users]]
name = "Bob"
role = "user"

docs.title: Query Syntax
docs.text: tmq uses dot notation to access TOML values: - title → root-level keys - database.host → nested table values - users[0].name → array element access

docs.title: Check Installation
docs.text:
tmq --version
tmq --help

docs.title: Basic Query
docs.text:
Create a test TOML file:

cat > config.toml << 'EOF'
title = "My App"
version = "1.0.0"

[database]
host = "localhost"
port = 5432
EOF

Query values:

# Get title
tmq '.title' config.toml
# Output: "My App"

# Get version
tmq '.version' config.toml
# Output: "1.0.0"

# Get database host
tmq '.database.host' config.toml
# Output: "localhost"

# Get database port
tmq '.database.port' config.toml
# Output: 5432

docs.title: Display All Data
docs.text:
# Show entire file
tmq '.' config.toml

# Format as JSON
tmq '.' config.toml -o json

# Format as YAML
tmq '.' config.toml -o yaml

docs.title: Stdin Input
docs.text:
# Read from stdin
cat config.toml | tmq '.version'

# Use with other tools
echo 'version = "2.0.0"' | tmq '.version'

docs.title: Error Handling in Scripts
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
VERSION=$(tmq '.version' config.toml)
if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    echo "Error reading version from config.toml"
    exit 1
fi
echo "Version: $VERSION"

docs.title: File Operations
docs.text:
# Check if file exists and is valid TOML
if tmq '.' config.toml > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo "config.toml is valid"
else
    echo "config.toml is invalid or missing"
fi

docs.title: Quick Reference
docs.text: Command Description tmq '.key' file.toml Query a value tmq '.' file.toml Show entire file tmq '.' file.toml -o json Output as JSON cat file.toml \| tmq '.key' Read from stdin tmq --validate file.toml Validate TOML syntax tmq --help Show help

docs.title: Exit Codes
docs.text: tmq uses standard exit codes: - 0: Success - 1: Parse/runtime error - 2: Usage error - 3: Security error - 4: File error

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: tmq is distributed as pre-compiled binaries for multiple platforms. No external dependencies required.

docs.title: Download Binary

wget https://github.com/azolfagharj/tmq/releases/latest/download/tmq-linux-amd64

docs.title: Manual Installation
docs.text:
1. Download the appropriate binary for your system
  2. Make executable (Linux/macOS): bash chmod +x tmq-*
  3. Rename to tmq (or tmq.exe on Windows): bash mv tmq-linux-amd64 tmq
  4. Move to PATH (optional but recommended): bash sudo mv tmq /usr/local/bin/

docs.title: Build from Source
docs.text: If you prefer to build from source:

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text: • Go 1.23 or later

docs.title: Build Steps

git clone https://github.com/azolfagharj/tmq.git
cd tmq
go build -o bin/tmq ./cmd/tmq

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
After installation, verify tmq is working:

tmq --version
# Should show: tmq version 1.0.1

tmq --help
# Should show help text

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• OS: Linux, macOS, Windows
  • Architecture: AMD64, ARM64
  • Memory: Minimal (works with < 10MB RAM)
  • Storage: ~5MB for the binary
  • No external dependencies - completely self-contained

docs.title: Updating
docs.text:
To update to the latest version:

  1. Download the new binary from releases
  2. Replace the old binary
  3. Make sure it's executable (chmod +x tmq)

docs.title: Permission Denied
docs.text:
If you get "permission denied" when running tmq:

chmod +x /path/to/tmq

docs.title: Command Not Found
docs.text: If tmq command is not found: - Make sure it's in your PATH: echo $PATH - Or use the full path: /usr/local/bin/tmq

docs.title: Download Issues
docs.text:
If wget fails, try using curl:

curl -L -o tmq https://github.com/azolfagharj/tmq/releases/latest/download/tmq-linux-amd64

docs.title: Modification Operations
docs.text: tmq supports in-place modification of TOML files, allowing you to set new values or delete existing keys.

docs.title: Basic Value Assignment
docs.text:
# Set a simple string value
tmq '.version = "2.0.0"' -i config.toml

# Set a number
tmq '.port = 8080' -i config.toml

# Set a boolean
tmq '.enabled = true' -i config.toml

docs.title: Nested Table Values
docs.text:
# Before
[database]
host = "oldhost"

# Update nested value
tmq '.database.host = "newhost"' -i config.toml

# After
[database]
host = "newhost"

docs.title: Creating New Keys
docs.text:
# Add new root-level key
tmq '.new_key = "new_value"' -i config.toml

# Add nested key
tmq '.database.pool_size = 10' -i config.toml

docs.title: Deep Nesting
docs.text:
# Create deep nested structure
tmq '.app.cache.redis.ttl = 3600' -i config.toml

# This creates:
# [app.cache.redis]
# ttl = 3600

docs.title: Array Values
docs.text:
# Set array of strings
tmq '.tags = ["web", "api", "prod"]' -i config.toml

# Set array of numbers
tmq '.ports = [8080, 8443, 9000]' -i config.toml

docs.title: Complex Objects
docs.text:
# Set an inline table
tmq '.credentials = { username = "admin", password = "secret" }' -i config.toml

# Set nested object
tmq '.database = { host = "localhost", port = 5432 }' -i config.toml

docs.title: Delete Root Keys
docs.text:
# Delete a top-level key
tmq 'del(.obsolete_key)' -i config.toml

docs.title: Delete Nested Keys
docs.text:
# Delete from nested table
tmq 'del(.database.old_setting)' -i config.toml

docs.title: Delete Array Elements
docs.text:
# Delete specific array index
tmq 'del(.servers[1])' -i config.toml

docs.title: Preview Changes
docs.text:
# See what would be changed without modifying the file
tmq '.version = "3.0.0"' --dry-run config.toml

# Preview deletion
tmq 'del(.obsolete_key)' --dry-run config.toml

docs.title: Safe Modifications
docs.text:
# Always test with dry-run first
tmq '.database.host = "prod-db"' --dry-run config.toml

# Then apply if it looks correct
tmq '.database.host = "prod-db"' -i config.toml

docs.title: Configuration Updates
docs.text:
# config.toml before
[app]
version = "1.0.0"
debug = true

[database]
host = "dev-db"
port = 5432

# Update for production deployment
tmq '.app.version = "1.1.0"' -i config.toml
tmq '.app.debug = false' -i config.toml
tmq '.database.host = "prod-db"' -i config.toml

# config.toml after
[app]
version = "1.1.0"
debug = false

[database]
host = "prod-db"
port = 5432

docs.title: Environment-Specific Configuration
docs.text:
# Development settings
tmq '.database.host = "localhost"' -i config.toml
tmq '.debug = true' -i config.toml

# Production settings
tmq '.database.host = "prod.example.com"' -i config.toml
tmq '.debug = false' -i config.toml

docs.title: Cleanup Operations
docs.text:
# Remove deprecated settings
tmq 'del(.legacy_feature)' -i config.toml
tmq 'del(.old_database_url)' -i config.toml

# Remove test users
tmq 'del(.test_users)' -i config.toml

docs.title: Non-existent Paths
docs.text:
# Setting non-existent parent creates the structure
tmq '.new.deep.key = "value"' -i config.toml
# Creates: [new.deep]
#          key = "value"

docs.title: Type Conflicts
docs.text:
# Overwriting different types is allowed
tmq '.value = "string"' -i config.toml  # was a number
tmq '.value = 42' -i config.toml        # was a string

docs.title: Invalid Operations
docs.text:
# Invalid key names
tmq '.invalid key = "value"' -i config.toml
# Error: invalid set expression

# Missing quotes for strings
tmq '.name = John' -i config.toml
# Error: invalid set expression

docs.title: Manual Backup
docs.text:
# Always backup before modification
cp config.toml config.toml.backup

# Make changes
tmq '.version = "2.0.0"' -i config.toml

# Verify
tmq '.version' config.toml

docs.title: Scripted Backup
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
CONFIG_FILE="config.toml"
BACKUP_FILE="${CONFIG_FILE}.backup.$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)"

cp "$CONFIG_FILE" "$BACKUP_FILE"
echo "Backup created: $BACKUP_FILE"

# Make changes
tmq '.version = "2.0.0"' -i "$CONFIG_FILE"

# Verify
if tmq '.version' "$CONFIG_FILE" >/dev/null; then
    echo "Update successful"
else
    echo "Update failed, restoring backup"
    cp "$BACKUP_FILE" "$CONFIG_FILE"
fi

docs.title: Performance Considerations
docs.text:
• In-place modifications are efficient - only changed parts are rewritten
  • Large files may take longer due to full file rewrite
  • Consider using dry-run for large or critical files

docs.title: Validation
docs.text:
# Validate after modifications
tmq '.' config.toml > /dev/null || echo "Invalid TOML after modification"

docs.title: Atomic Operations
docs.text:
# Use temporary files for critical updates
TEMP_FILE=$(mktemp)
cp config.toml "$TEMP_FILE"

tmq '.critical_setting = "new_value"' -i "$TEMP_FILE"

# Validate
if tmq '.' "$TEMP_FILE" >/dev/null; then
    mv "$TEMP_FILE" config.toml
    echo "Update successful"
else
    rm "$TEMP_FILE"
    echo "Update failed - invalid TOML"
fi

docs.title: Version Control
docs.text:
# Commit before and after modifications
git add config.toml
git commit -m "Update configuration via tmq"

# Make changes
tmq '.version = "2.0.0"' -i config.toml

git add config.toml
git commit -m "Bump version to 2.0.0"

docs.title: Script Integration
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
set -e

# Function to safely update config
update_config() {
    local key="$1"
    local value="$2"
    local file="$3"

    echo "Updating $key = $value in $file"

    # Dry run first
    if tmq "$key = $value" --dry-run "$file" >/dev/null; then
        tmq "$key = $value" -i "$file"
        echo "✓ Updated successfully"
    else
        echo "✗ Update failed"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Update multiple settings
update_config '.version' '"2.0.0"' config.toml
update_config '.debug' 'false' config.toml
update_config '.database.port' '5432' config.toml

docs.title: Query Operations
docs.text: tmq provides powerful querying capabilities to extract data from TOML files using a simple dot notation syntax.

enabled = true

tmq '.title' config.toml     # "My App"

[app.config.cache]

docs.title: Access Array Elements
docs.text:
[[servers]]
name = "web1"
ip = "192.168.1.1"

[[servers]]
name = "web2"
ip = "192.168.1.2"

[[servers]]

ip = "192.168.1.10"

# Second server

# Database server

docs.title: Array of Values
docs.text:
ports = [8080, 8443, 9000]
tags = ["web", "api", "admin"]

# Access entire arrays
tmq '.ports' config.toml      # [8080, 8443, 9000]
tmq '.tags' config.toml       # ["web", "api", "admin"]

# Access array elements
tmq '.ports[0]' config.toml   # 8080
tmq '.ports[1]' config.toml   # 8443
tmq '.tags[2]' config.toml    # "admin"

docs.title: Default TOML Output
docs.text:
tmq '.database' config.toml
# Output: host = "localhost"
#         port = 5432

docs.title: JSON Output
docs.text:
tmq '.database' config.toml -o json
# Output: {"host":"localhost","port":5432}

docs.title: YAML Output
docs.text:
tmq '.database' config.toml -o yaml
# Output: host: localhost
#         port: 5432

docs.title: Complex Structures
docs.text:
[app]
name = "myapp"

[app.database]
host = "db.example.com"
credentials = { username = "admin", password = "secret" }

[app.features]
logging = true
metrics = { enabled = true, port = 9090 }

# Access nested objects
tmq '.app.database.credentials' config.toml
# Output: username = "admin"
#         password = "secret"

tmq '.app.database.credentials.username' config.toml    # "admin"
tmq '.app.features.metrics' config.toml
# Output: enabled = true
#         port = 9090

docs.title: Mixed Data Types
docs.text:
# config.toml
version = "1.2.3"
debug = true
timeout = 30
pi = 3.14159

[metadata]
created = 2024-01-15T10:30:00Z
tags = ["production", "stable"]

tmq '.version' config.toml     # "1.2.3"
tmq '.debug' config.toml       # true
tmq '.timeout' config.toml     # 30
tmq '.pi' config.toml          # 3.14159
tmq '.metadata.tags' config.toml    # ["production", "stable"]

docs.title: Access Everything
docs.text:
# Show entire file
tmq '.' config.toml

# Same as above (explicit root)
tmq '. .' config.toml

docs.title: Root with Different Formats
docs.text:
# JSON output of entire file
tmq '.' config.toml -o json

# YAML output of entire file
tmq '.' config.toml -o yaml

docs.title: Non-existent Keys
docs.text:
tmq '.nonexistent' config.toml
# Error: key 'nonexistent' not found
# Exit code: 1

docs.title: Invalid Paths
docs.text:
tmq '.invalid..path' config.toml
# Error: invalid query path
# Exit code: 1

docs.title: Type Mismatches
docs.text:
# Trying to access array index on a non-array
tmq '.title[0]' config.toml
# Error: cannot index into string
# Exit code: 1

docs.title: Performance Notes
docs.text:
• Queries are evaluated in constant time O(1)
  • Memory usage scales with the size of the queried data
  • Large files (>100MB) may require increased memory limits

docs.title: Scripting
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Safe querying with error handling
DB_HOST=$(tmq '.database.host' config.toml 2>/dev/null) || {
    echo "Error: Could not read database host from config"
    exit 1
}
echo "Database host: $DB_HOST"

docs.title: Validation Before Query
docs.text:
# Check if file is valid before querying
if tmq '.' config.toml >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    VERSION=$(tmq '.version' config.toml)
    echo "Version: $VERSION"
else
    echo "Invalid TOML file"
    exit 1
fi

docs.title: Use Appropriate Output Format
docs.text:
# For scripts, use raw output (default)
HOST=$(tmq '.database.host' config.toml)

# For data processing, use JSON
tmq '.servers' config.toml -o json | jq '.[0].name'

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: Common issues and solutions when using tmq.

docs.title: Command Not Found
docs.text:
tmq --version
# bash: tmq: command not found

Solutions: 1. Check PATH: bash echo $PATH which tmq

  1. Use full path: bash /usr/local/bin/tmq --version ./tmq --version

  2. Reinstall: bash # Download again wget https://github.com/azolfagharj/tmq/releases/latest/download/tmq-linux-amd64 chmod +x tmq-linux-amd64 sudo mv tmq-linux-amd64 /usr/local/bin/tmq

docs.title: Permission Denied
docs.text:
./tmq --version
# bash: ./tmq: Permission denied

Solution:

chmod +x tmq
./tmq --version

docs.title: Unsupported Platform
docs.text:
# Trying to run ARM binary on x86 system
./tmq-linux-arm64 --version
# exec format error

Solution: Download the correct binary for your platform: - Linux x86_64: tmq-linux-amd64 - Linux ARM64: tmq-linux-arm64 - macOS Intel: tmq-darwin-amd64 - macOS Apple Silicon: tmq-darwin-arm64 - Windows: tmq-windows-amd64.exe

docs.title: Invalid Query Path
docs.text:
tmq '.invalid..path' config.toml
# ERROR: Invalid query path

Common mistakes: 1. Empty path segments: ```bash # Wrong tmq '.database..' config.toml

# Right tmq '.database' config.toml ```

  1. Invalid characters: ```bash # Wrong (spaces in path) tmq '.my key' config.toml

# Right (use underscores or different structure) tmq '.my_key' config.toml ```

  1. Unmatched brackets: ```bash # Wrong tmq '.array[0' config.toml

# Right tmq '.array[0]' config.toml ```

docs.title: Key Not Found
docs.text:
tmq '.nonexistent' config.toml
# ERROR: key 'nonexistent' not found

Solutions: 1. Check key exists: ```bash # List all keys tmq '.' config.toml

# Check specific section tmq '.database' config.toml ```

  1. Case sensitivity: toml [Database] # Capital D host = "localhost" ```bash # Wrong tmq '.database.host' config.toml

# Right tmq '.Database.host' config.toml ```

  1. Array vs object: ```toml # This is an array of tables [[servers]] name = "server1"

# This is a table [database] host = "localhost" ```

docs.title: Array Index Out of Bounds
docs.text:
tmq '.servers[10]' config.toml
# ERROR: array index 10 out of bounds

Solution: Check array length first:

# See the array
tmq '.servers' config.toml

# Get array length (in scripts)
length=$(tmq '.servers | length' config.toml)

docs.title: Cannot Modify File
docs.text:
tmq '.version = "2.0"' -i config.toml
# ERROR: File operation error
# DETAILS: Cannot write to file 'config.toml'

Solutions: 1. Check permissions: bash ls -la config.toml chmod 644 config.toml

  1. Check disk space: bash df -h

  2. File locked: bash # Check if file is open by another process lsof config.toml

docs.title: Invalid Set Expression
docs.text:
tmq '.version = ' -i config.toml
# ERROR: Invalid set expression

Common syntax errors: 1. Missing value: ```bash # Wrong tmq '.version =' -i config.toml

# Right tmq '.version = "2.0"' -i config.toml ```

  1. Unquoted strings: ```bash # Wrong (if value contains spaces or special chars) tmq '.path = /usr/local/bin' -i config.toml

# Right tmq '.path = "/usr/local/bin"' -i config.toml ```

  1. Invalid TOML values: ```bash # Wrong tmq '.value = [unclosed array' -i config.toml

# Right tmq '.value = ["item1", "item2"]' -i config.toml ```

docs.title: TOML Parse Error
docs.text:
tmq --validate config.toml
# ERROR: TOML parsing failed
# DETAILS: Expected newline at line 5, column 10

Common TOML syntax errors: 1. Missing quotes: ```toml # Wrong title = My App

# Right title = "My App" ```

  1. Invalid array syntax: ```toml # Wrong items = [1, 2, 3

# Right items = [1, 2, 3] ```

  1. Invalid table definition: ```toml # Wrong [section key = "value"

# Right [section] key = "value" ```

docs.title: File Encoding Issues
docs.text:
tmq --validate config.toml
# ERROR: Invalid UTF-8 encoding

Solution: Convert file to UTF-8:

# Check current encoding
file config.toml

# Convert to UTF-8
iconv -f latin1 -t utf8 config.toml > config_utf8.toml
mv config_utf8.toml config.toml

docs.title: Files Are Different But Should Match
docs.text:
tmq --compare file1.toml file2.toml
# Files are different

Possible causes: 1. Different formatting: ```toml # file1.toml host="localhost"

# file2.toml host = "localhost" ``` These are semantically identical but formatted differently.

  1. Comments ignored: TOML comments are not part of the data structure.

  2. Order differences: ```toml # Different order, same content [table] b = 2 a = 1

[table] a = 1 b = 2 ```

docs.title: Slow Operations on Large Files
docs.text:
time tmq '.' large.toml > /dev/null
# Takes several seconds

Solutions: 1. Use specific queries: ```bash # Instead of full file tmq '.' large.toml

# Use specific path tmq '.database.host' large.toml ```

  1. Output to file instead of stdout: bash tmq '.' large.toml -o json > output.json

  2. Check file size: bash ls -lh large.toml # If > 50MB, consider splitting

docs.title: High Memory Usage
docs.text:
# Monitor memory
/usr/bin/time -v tmq '.' large.toml

Solutions: 1. Process in chunks: bash # Instead of whole file, process sections tmq '.section1' large.toml tmq '.section2' large.toml

  1. Use streaming for large outputs: bash tmq '.' large.toml | head -100

docs.title: Too Many Files
docs.text:
tmq '.version' config/*.toml
# Argument list too long

Solution: Use find or process in batches:

# Use find
find config/ -name "*.toml" -exec tmq '.version' {} \;

# Process in batches
for file in config/*.toml; do
    tmq '.version' "$file"
done

docs.title: Inconsistent Results
docs.text:
tmq '.version' config/*.toml
# Some files show different output format

Cause: Different files may have different structures.

Solution: Handle missing keys:

# Use default values
tmq '.version // "unknown"' config/*.toml

docs.title: Exit Code Handling
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
tmq '.nonexistent' config.toml
echo "Exit code: $?"
# Always prints exit code, even if command fails

Solution: Use proper error handling:

#!/bin/bash
set -e  # Exit on first error

if ! tmq '.nonexistent' config.toml >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo "Key not found"
    exit 1
fi

docs.title: Output Parsing Issues
docs.text:
# Trying to parse multi-line output
version=$(tmq '.' config.toml | grep version)
# Unreliable

Solution: Use specific queries:

version=$(tmq '.version' config.toml)

docs.title: Variable Interpolation
docs.text:
# Wrong
tmq '.version = $VERSION' -i config.toml

# Right
tmq ".version = \"$VERSION\"" -i config.toml

docs.title: Windows Path Issues
docs.text:
REM Wrong (backslashes in paths)
tmq ".path = C:\Program Files\app" -i config.toml

REM Right (forward slashes or quoted)
tmq ".path = \"C:/Program Files/app\"" -i config.toml

docs.title: macOS Permission Issues
docs.text:
# When installed in /usr/local/bin
sudo tmq --version
# May require sudo if installed system-wide

docs.title: Proxy Issues
docs.text:
# If behind corporate proxy
export https_proxy=http://proxy.company.com:8080
wget https://github.com/azolfagharj/tmq/releases/latest/download/tmq-linux-amd64

docs.title: Certificate Issues
docs.text:
# Skip SSL verification (not recommended for production)
wget --no-check-certificate https://github.com/azolfagharj/tmq/releases/latest/download/tmq-linux-amd64

docs.title: Firewall Blocking Downloads
docs.text:
# Check connectivity
curl -I https://github.com/azolfagharj/tmq/releases/latest/download/tmq-linux-amd64

# Use alternative download method
curl -L -o tmq https://github.com/azolfagharj/tmq/releases/latest/download/tmq-linux-amd64

docs.title: Debug Information
docs.text:
# Collect system info
uname -a
tmq --version

# Test with simple file
echo 'test = "value"' > test.toml
tmq '.test' test.toml

docs.title: Issue Reporting
docs.text: When reporting issues, include: 1. tmq version: tmq --version 2. Platform: uname -a 3. Command that fails 4. Full error output 5. Sample TOML file (if applicable) 6. Expected vs actual behavior

docs.title: Community Support
docs.text:
• GitHub Issues: https://github.com/azolfagharj/tmq/issues
  • Discussions: https://github.com/azolfagharj/tmq/discussions

docs.title: Quick Fixes
docs.text: Issue Quick Fix Command not found export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin Permission denied chmod +x tmq Invalid query Check syntax: tmq --help File not found ls -la config.toml Parse error Validate: tmq --validate config.toml Memory issues Use specific queries instead of full file Bulk operations slow Process in smaller batches

docs.title: Validation & Comparison
docs.text: tmq provides tools to validate TOML files and compare differences between them.

docs.title: Basic Syntax Validation
docs.text:
# Check if TOML file is valid
tmq --validate config.toml

# Returns exit code 0 if valid, 1 if invalid
echo $?  # Check exit code

docs.title: Batch Validation
docs.text:
# Validate multiple files
tmq --validate config/*.toml

# Use with find
find . -name "*.toml" -exec tmq --validate {} \;

docs.title: Validation in Scripts
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
validate_toml() {
    local file="$1"
    if tmq --validate "$file" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo "✓ $file is valid"
        return 0
    else
        echo "✗ $file is invalid"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Validate all TOML files in directory
for file in *.toml; do
    validate_toml "$file" || exit 1
done

docs.title: Basic File Comparison
docs.text:
# Compare two TOML files
tmq --compare config1.toml config2.toml

# Exit codes:
# 0 = files are identical
# 1 = files are different

docs.title: Detailed Comparison Output
docs.text:
# See detailed differences
tmq --compare old-config.toml new-config.toml

docs.title: Comparison in CI/CD
docs.text:
# Fail build if configuration changed unexpectedly
if ! tmq --compare expected.toml actual.toml >/dev/null; then
    echo "Configuration mismatch!"
    tmq --compare expected.toml actual.toml
    exit 1
fi

docs.title: Validation with Error Details
docs.text:
# tmq shows detailed error messages
tmq --validate invalid.toml
# Error: parse error: expected newline at line 5, column 10
# DETAILS: Check your TOML syntax
# ACTION: Fix the syntax error and try again

docs.title: Comparison with Output
docs.text:
# Redirect comparison output to file
tmq --compare file1.toml file2.toml > differences.txt

# Use in scripts
if tmq --compare "$EXPECTED" "$ACTUAL" > diff.log; then
    echo "Files match"
else
    echo "Differences found:"
    cat diff.log
fi

docs.title: Pre-commit Hook
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# .git/hooks/pre-commit

# Validate all TOML files
echo "Validating TOML files..."
if ! find . -name "*.toml" -exec tmq --validate {} \;; then
    echo "TOML validation failed"
    exit 1
fi

echo "All TOML files are valid"

docs.title: Configuration Drift Detection
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Check if production config matches expected config

PROD_CONFIG="prod-config.toml"
EXPECTED_CONFIG="expected-config.toml"

if tmq --compare "$EXPECTED_CONFIG" "$PROD_CONFIG" >/dev/null; then
    echo "✓ Production config matches expected configuration"
    exit 0
else
    echo "✗ Configuration drift detected!"
    echo "Differences:"
    tmq --compare "$EXPECTED_CONFIG" "$PROD_CONFIG"
    exit 1
fi

docs.title: CI Pipeline Integration
docs.text:
# .github/workflows/validate.yml
name: Validate Configuration

on:
  pull_request:
    paths:
      - 'config/*.toml'

jobs:
  validate:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: checkout@v4

      - name: Setup tmq
        run: |
          wget https://github.com/azolfagharj/tmq/releases/latest/download/tmq-linux-amd64
          chmod +x tmq-linux-amd64
          sudo mv tmq-linux-amd64 /usr/local/bin/tmq

      - name: Validate TOML files
        run: |
          for file in config/*.toml; do
            echo "Validating $file..."
            tmq --validate "$file"
          done

      - name: Check configuration consistency
        run: |
          tmq --compare config/base.toml config/production.toml

docs.title: Validation Errors
docs.text:
# Syntax errors
tmq --validate malformed.toml
# ERROR: TOML parsing failed
# DETAILS: Expected newline at line 5, column 10
# ACTION: Check your TOML syntax and fix any formatting issues

# File not found
tmq --validate nonexistent.toml
# ERROR: File operation error
# DETAILS: Cannot read file 'nonexistent.toml'
# ACTION: Ensure the file exists and is readable

docs.title: Comparison Errors
docs.text:
# File not found
tmq --compare missing1.toml missing2.toml
# ERROR: File operation error
# DETAILS: Cannot read file 'missing1.toml'
# ACTION: Ensure both files exist and are readable

# Parse error in one file
tmq --compare valid.toml invalid.toml
# ERROR: TOML parsing failed
# DETAILS: Invalid TOML in 'invalid.toml'
# ACTION: Fix the TOML syntax in invalid.toml

docs.title: Validation Output
docs.text:
# Successful validation (no output, exit code 0)
tmq --validate valid.toml

# Failed validation (error message, exit code 1)
tmq --validate invalid.toml

docs.title: Comparison Output
docs.text:
# Identical files (no output, exit code 0)
tmq --compare same1.toml same1.toml

# Different files (shows differences, exit code 1)
tmq --compare old.toml new.toml
# Files are different:
# - old.toml: version = "1.0.0"
# + new.toml: version = "2.0.0"

docs.title: Validation in Development
docs.text:
# Add to your build process
make validate-config:
    @for file in config/*.toml; do \
        echo "Validating $$file..."; \
        tmq --validate "$$file" || exit 1; \
    done
    @echo "All configurations valid"

docs.title: Configuration Testing
docs.text:
# Test configuration changes
#!/bin/bash

CONFIG_FILE="app-config.toml"
BACKUP_FILE="${CONFIG_FILE}.backup"

# Backup current config
cp "$CONFIG_FILE" "$BACKUP_FILE"

# Make test changes
tmq '.debug = true' -i "$CONFIG_FILE"
tmq '.test_mode = true' -i "$CONFIG_FILE"

# Validate changes
if tmq --validate "$CONFIG_FILE" >/dev/null; then
    echo "✓ Configuration changes are valid"
    # Test your application here
    # ./run-tests.sh
else
    echo "✗ Invalid configuration after changes"
fi

# Restore backup
mv "$BACKUP_FILE" "$CONFIG_FILE"

docs.title: Version Control Integration
docs.text:
# Check for configuration changes in commits
git diff --name-only HEAD~1 | grep '\.toml$' | while read -r file; do
    echo "Checking $file..."
    if ! tmq --validate "$file" >/dev/null; then
        echo "Invalid TOML in $file"
        exit 1
    fi
done

docs.title: Monitoring Configuration Changes
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Monitor configuration for unauthorized changes

BASELINE="config-baseline.toml"
CURRENT="config.toml"

if [ ! -f "$BASELINE" ]; then
    echo "Creating baseline configuration..."
    cp "$CURRENT" "$BASELINE"
    exit 0
fi

if ! tmq --compare "$BASELINE" "$CURRENT" >/dev/null; then
    echo "WARNING: Configuration has changed!"
    echo "Differences:"
    tmq --compare "$BASELINE" "$CURRENT"

    read -p "Accept changes and update baseline? (y/N): " -n 1 -r
    echo
    if [[ $REPLY =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
        cp "$CURRENT" "$BASELINE"
        echo "Baseline updated"
    fi
fi

docs.title: Performance
docs.text:
• Validation is fast - typically < 100ms for most files
  • Comparison speed depends on file size and differences
  • Memory usage is minimal for both operations

docs.title: Exit Codes Summary
docs.text: Operation Success Error Validation 0 1 (parse error) Comparison 0 (identical) 1 (different) File errors - 4 (file not found/readable)
